results.body: While interviewing Rob Manfred for his book about baseball, Joe Kelly, an outspoken reliever, realized their goals weren’t all that different.
results.title: Finding Common Ground With the Commissioner

results.body: The star-laden White Sox underperformed last year. Pedro Grifol plans to wake up the A.L. Central’s “sleeping horse.”
results.title: Chicago’s New Manager Has a Clear Message: Details Matter

results.body: Tim Anderson did a little bit of everything in helping his team crush Canada at the World Baseball Classic. All in a day’s work for a certified baseball dude.
results.title: An Infielder Who ‘Wants the Moment’ Thrives for the U.S.

results.body: Anderson Comás, a relief pitcher in the Chicago White Sox organization, said he wanted to be “an inspiration.”
results.title: In Rare Move, White Sox Minor Leaguer Announces He Is Gay

results.body: In his new book, Tyler Kepner digs into the history of the Fall Classic, including a look at unheralded players who stepped up for their teams at exactly the right time.
results.title: In the World Series, These Little-Known Players Came Up Big

results.body: The Mets’ lead over Atlanta is down to half a game, the Rays are closing in on the Yankees and the surprising Guardians are fending off serious challengers in the A.L. Central.
results.title: An Expanded Postseason Hasn’t Dulled Baseball’s Stretch Run

results.body: The Chicago White Sox have been slowed by injuries and mocked for odd decisions. A 19-game stretch against division rivals could make or break their year.
results.title: A Season on the Line

results.body: Donaldson, the Yankees third baseman, referred to Tim Anderson of the White Sox as “Jackie,” which M.L.B. said was “disrespectful.” Donaldson appealed the one-game suspension.
results.title: Josh Donaldson Suspended for ‘Jackie’ Comments

results.body: M.L.B. will investigate Saturday’s incident between Donaldson, the Yankees third baseman, and Chicago’s Tim Anderson.
results.title: White Sox Call Josh Donaldson’s ‘Jackie’ Comments Racist

results.body: When Albert Pujols collected hit No. 3,314, the Cardinals celebrated him for passing Collins on the career hits list. Some recordkeepers weren’t so sure.
results.title: How Many Hits Did Eddie Collins Have? It Varies.
